an6.87:4.1: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is unable to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
an6.87:4.3: They murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re witless, dull, and stupid.
an6.87:4.4: Someone with these six qualities is unable to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.
an6.87:5.1: Someone with six qualities is able to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities when listening to the true teaching.
an6.87:5.3: They don’t murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They don’t maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They don’t cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re not witless, dull, and stupid.
an6.87:5.4: Someone with these six qualities is able to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
